meanings.definition: The action of constricting or the state of being constricted.
meanings.sent1: The constrictions in the snake's body help it to catch its prey.
meanings.sent2: I felt the constrictions in my chest when I was nervous.
meanings.sent3: The constrictions in the garden hose made watering the plants a challenge.
meanings.sent4: The constrictions of fear gripped her heart tightly.
meanings.sent5: The constrictions of traffic made the journey seem endless.

meanings.definition: Something that constricts, such as a tight band or a narrowing of a passage.
meanings.sent1: She removed the constrictions from her wrist after the blood test.
meanings.sent2: The constrictions in the cave made it difficult to pass through.
meanings.sent3: The constrictions in the balloon caused it to pop unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: The constrictions of rules limited our creativity in the project.
meanings.sent5: The constrictions of the belt made it hard to breathe properly.
